About the product
  • ONLY all natural, zero calorie, zero glycemic sweetener. Lakanto Sweetners are sugar free and have none of the bitter chemical after taste like Stevia and Xylitol.
  • PROPRIETARY mixture of the highest purity Monk Fruit extract & Non-GMO erythritol. Lakanto is a perfect sweetener for blood sugar and weight management.
  • 1:1 SUGAR REPLACEMENT - Unlike monk fruit in the raw that has a light yeast flake feel; Lakanto has a perfect mix of monk fruit and erythritol (naturally found in many fruits and vegetables) to match the sweetness of sugar and maintain 1 for 1 sugar replacement.
  • ZERO EFFECT on blood sugar or insulin levels, making it a great sweetener for blood sugar and weight management. Ideal for sports enthusiasts, ketosis diets and those trying to watch their sugar consumption
  • CLASSIC & GOLDEN - Golden Lakanto is a brown sugar substitute and our Classic White is a white sugar substitute. We use Non GMO Eurythritol and we don't use Xylitol that can cause gas.
More

Important information

Ingredients

Erythritol, Monk Fruit Extract.

Directions

Store in a cool dry place.

Legal Disclaimer

Erythritol, a main ingredient in this Lakanto Monkfruit blend, is known to have side effects for some people, particularly when consumed in excessive amounts. While Erythritol side effects are rare, they may include: diarrhea, stomach cramps/discomfort, headache, and bloating. In extremely rare cases, the use of Erythritol can cause an allergic reaction in the form of hives. The good news is that the use of Monk Fruit in this product significantly reduces the quantity of Erythritol necessary to replace sugar in your cooking and baking! However, because of the presence of Erythritol, we recommend that Lakanto Monkfruit Sweetener be tried in small doses at first in order to screen out the potential of any negative reaction.

Statements regarding dietary supplements have not been evaluated by the FDA and are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or health condition.

5.0 out of 5 stars... genuine New York Cheesecake using MONKFRUIT sweetener and I'm amazed. The taste is beyond just comparable
November 10, 2017
Flavor: Classic WhiteSize: 3 IbsVerified Purchase
I just finished making a genuine New York Cheesecake using MONKFRUIT sweetener and I'm amazed. The taste is beyond just comparable. It is indistinguishable. I will not hesitate to use this product in any of my favorite baking recipes. I only wish this was around when my mom, who suffered from Diabetes, was still alive so she could continue to enjoy all her favorite baked goods without worrying about her blood sugar.

I highly recommend MONKFRUIT. It is worth every penny. My only hesitation in sharing this review is that more people will try it, buy it and then my ability to get it so quickly will be effected. So buy it, but save some for me.

N. Keithley
TOP 1000 REVIEWER
5.0 out of 5 starsBottom line: Zero Glycemic Index, delicious sugary taste without the bad carbs - I'm buying more!
November 24, 2017
Flavor: Classic WhiteSize: 3 IbsVerified Purchase
This is the best sugar substitute I have used. It is so good, in fact, that my husband has started using it to make his sweet tea. This is important because a) hubby is diabetic, and b) Lakanto Monkfruit blend has a ZERO glycemic level, meaning it will NOT raise your blood sugar. That is important in weight loss and in maintaining a healthy a1c (according to hubby's doctor).

I have read other comments and found that some people are criticizing Lakanto for the cost of this blend because it is purportedly mostly Erythritol.The truth is that none of us really knows how much Monkfruit and how much Erythritol there is in it because it is a proprietary blend. (People seem to be basing this claim on the 4 grams of sugar alcohols under carbs on the nutritional label, which would be the Erythritol). Monkfruit by itself is a very strong sweetener (estimated up to three-HUNDRED times the sweetness of sugar in its purest form, according to my online research - note - I am neither a doctor nor nutritionist so please do your own due diligence), so not much monkfruit is required for a lot of sweetening power. [Erythritol is a sugar alcohol. Since there are 4 carbs of "sugar alcohols" in Erythritol, this is considered by most modern carb counters to be ZERO net carbs. Sugar Alcohols do not impact your body, weight or glycemic index (GI) the same way as "regular" carbs or sugars. They are eliminated before impacting your GI.

I'm just going to reiterate here - I don't care how much Erythritol there is when there is a product with very fine grains that dissolve smoothly and completely, even in cold iced tea, give major sweetening power without the cooling effect Erythritol is known for, and that personally, I don't care for, as that cooling effect reinforces the idea that this is NOT sugar.

Monkfruit sweetens the closest to sugar of anything I've ever tasted. I'll be back for more!
Read more

BebeBoucheTop Contributor: Baby
5.0 out of 5 starsBEST SWEETENER - NOT JUST FOR PEOPLE WITH DIABETES! SPREAD THE WORD!!!
January 18, 2018
Flavor: GoldenSize: 3 IbsVerified Purchase
PROS:
*This the best sweetener for anyone wishing to lower sugar intake, not just those with diabetes.
*Tastes great. However, we don't agree it's a 1:1 ratio of Lakanto MFS to sugar. The ratio is more like 2:1, so you would need 2 teaspoons of Lakanto MFS for every 1 teaspoon of regular cane sugar. This opinion does not, in any way, reduce the value of this product. It really does not impact blood sugar...PRICELESS!

CONS: Cost is WAY TOO EXPENSIVE. We feel blessed to be able to afford this, but not everyone can afford a sweetener that costs 8-10 times as much as common cane sugar. The process to refine monkfruit sugar is no longer under patent, which it was for 20 years. Please spread the word about this great sweetener to drive up demand. Hopefully, that will encourage our capitalist society to bring more competitors in and bring down prices.

reedsrx
1.0 out of 5 starsThis product is mostly erythritol, NOT monk fruit. Deceptive advertising and over-priced.
January 3, 2017
Flavor: Classic WhiteSize: 235 gVerified Purchase
This product is mostly erythritol and should say so on Amazon's website, but it does not. You'll notice there is no photo of the ingredients list, and the answered questions state that the company will not reveal the contents. Monk fruit is a natural sugar, not a sugar alcohol, but erythritol IS a sugar alcohol. The nutritional data, which the company cannot avoid revealing, states that the product contains 4gm of sugar alcohols per serving, which is identical to erythritol. Monk fruit contains zero, so there is not enough monk fruit in the product to reduce the presence of the erythritol. So, you are buying erythritol with a smidgen of monk fruit. There are other products available that are actually monk fruit, if that's what you want. Erythritol, which is what you're buying here, is also available at a MUCH cheaper price. Don't fall for this deceptive marketing.
Read more

mommy2010
5.0 out of 5 starsThis one WINS over FIVE OTHERS
October 28, 2017
Flavor: GoldenSize: 235 gVerified Purchase
This one wins. NO laxative effect and NO bitter aftertaste. I have tried many other sugar substitutes: XYLITOL: laxative, STEVIA: bitter aftertaste, JUST LIKE SUGAR: slight bitter aftertaste, BOCHA SWEET: huge laxative effect, FRUCTEVIA: Bitter aftertaste. I almost gave up trying to find a sugar substitute and was going to resort to Coconut Sugar, but I gave it one last shot with this one because they had a small size to sample (8 oz) and I'm so glad I did! It is not as sweet as Stevia (neither is sugar), but it neutralizes the bitterness in coffee and tea, and it has a "clean" taste, no undertones. Even sugar has undertones that linger. Not this, and I like that. ALSO I was surprised by how fast and easily it dissolves. It was completely dissolved before I even stirred my tea!
